intro: Stigmaphyllon trifidum, commonly known as the three-lobed stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifid (three-lobed) leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
